person.label: Biography
person.note: Most biography articles include these sections to give readers a complete picture of the person's life and significance:

examples.title: Marie Curie
examples.text: Marie Curie (lahir Maria Salomea Skłodowska; 7 November 1867 – 4 Juli 1934) adalah seorang fisikawan dan kimiawan Polandia-Prancis yang melakukan penelitian perintis tentang radioaktivitas.

sections.name: Early life
sections.description: Birth, childhood, education, and formative experiences

place.label: Geographic Location
place.note: Location articles help readers understand both the physical place and human activity there:

examples.title: Paris
examples.text: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France. With an official estimated population of 2,102,650 residents as of 1 January 2023 in an area of more than 105 km2 (41 sq mi), Paris is the fourth-most populated city in the European Union and the 30th most densely populated city in the world in 2022.

sections.name: Geography
sections.description: Physical features, climate, and natural characteristics

sections.name: History
sections.description: How the area developed over time

species.label: Species
species.note: Species articles help readers identify and understand the organism in its natural context:

examples.title: Giant Panda
examples.text: The giant panda (Ailuropoda melanoleuca), sometimes called a panda bear or simply panda, is a bear species endemic to China. It is characterised by its black-and-white coat and rotund body. The name "giant panda" is sometimes used to distinguish it from the red panda, a neighboring musteloid.

sections.name: Habitat
sections.description: Where the species lives and environmental needs

organization.label: Organization
organization.note: Organization articles explain what the group does and how it operates:

examples.title: World Health Organization
examples.text: The World Health Organization (WHO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for international public health. It is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, and has six regional offices and 150 field offices worldwide.

sections.name: History
sections.description: How and why the organization was founded

academic.label: Academic Concept
academic.note: Academic articles explain complex ideas clearly for readers at different knowledge levels:

examples.title: Quantum Mechanics
examples.text: Quantum mechanics is a fundamental theory in physics that describes the physical properties of nature at the scale of atoms and subatomic particles. It is the foundation of all quantum physics including quantum chemistry, quantum field theory, quantum technology, and quantum information science.

sections.name: Definition
sections.description: Clear explanation of what the concept means
include: How it differs from related concepts

sections.name: Background
include: When and how it was first developed

creative.label: Creative Work
creative.note: Creative work articles cover both the content and the story behind its creation:

examples.title: The Beatles - Abbey Road
examples.text: Abbey Road is the eleventh studio album by the English rock band the Beatles, released on 26 September 1969. It is the last album the four members recorded together, although Let It Be was the last album completed before the band's break-up in April 1970.

sections.name: Production
sections.description: How the work was created or developed

event.label: Event
event.note: Event articles help readers understand what happened and why it mattered:

examples.title: Moon Landing
examples.text: The Apollo 11 mission was the spaceflight that first landed humans on the Moon. Commander Neil Armstrong and lunar module pilot Buzz Aldrin landed the Apollo Lunar Module Eagle on July 20, 1969, at 20:17 UTC, and Armstrong became the first person to step onto the Moon's surface six hours and 39 minutes later, on July 21 at 02:56 UTC.

sections.name: Background
sections.description: Circumstances leading up to the event
include: Prior events that led to this

sections.name: Timeline
sections.description: Key moments and how events unfolded

other.label: Other Topic
other.note: Here are some flexible sections that work for many different types of articles:

examples.title: Climate Change
examples.text: Climate change refers to long-term shifts in global or regional climate patterns, attributed largely to human activities since the mid-20th century, particularly the increased levels of greenhouse gases produced by burning fossil fuels.
